about.name: Dallas
about.info_text: Dallas is a dynamic and diverse city located in North Texas. It's known for its unique blend of modern innovation and rich history. The city offers a variety of experiences, from its vibrant arts and culture scene to its thriving business community. Dallas is home to iconic landmarks, a lively sports culture, and a rich culinary scene, making it a must-visit destination for travelers of all interests.
about.facts_text:
Population: Approximately 1.3 million
State: Texas
Time Zone: Central Time Zone (UTC-06:00)
Language: English
Currency: United States Dollar (USD)
about.climate_text: Dallas has a subtropical climate with hot, humid summers and mild winters. The city enjoys plenty of sunshine throughout the year, making it a great destination for outdoor activities.

attractions_card.alt: The Sixth Floor Museum at Dealey Plaza
attractions_card.title: The Sixth Floor Museum at Dealey Plaza
attractions_card.description: This museum chronicles the life, legacy, and assassination of President John F. Kennedy and is located in the former Texas School Book Depository building.

attractions_card.title: Dallas Arts District
attractions_card.description: The Dallas Arts District is one of the largest urban cultural districts in the country, featuring world-class museums, theaters, and performance spaces.

attractions_card.title: Reunion Tower
attractions_card.description: Reunion Tower offers stunning panoramic views of Dallas from its GeO-Deck observation deck, making it a popular spot for visitors.

attractions_card.alt: The Dallas Arboretum and Botanical Garden
attractions_card.title: The Dallas Arboretum and Botanical Garden
attractions_card.description: This beautiful garden features a wide variety of plants and seasonal displays, as well as scenic views of White Rock Lake.

attractions_card.title: AT&T Stadium
attractions_card.description: Home to the Dallas Cowboys, AT&T Stadium is an architectural marvel and a must-visit for sports fans. It also hosts concerts and events.

attractions_card.title: Klyde Warren Park
attractions_card.description: Klyde Warren Park is a unique urban park built over a freeway, offering green space, food trucks, and a range of activities for all ages.

attractions_card.title: Dallas World Aquarium
attractions_card.description: The Dallas World Aquarium is both an aquarium and a zoo, featuring a diverse collection of animals and marine life in a recreated rainforest habitat.

attractions_card.title: Pioneer Plaza
attractions_card.description: Pioneer Plaza is home to a larger-than-life bronze sculpture of a cattle drive, celebrating Dallas's Western heritage.

food_card.title: Tex-Mex Cuisine
food_card.description: Dallas is renowned for its Tex-Mex cuisine, featuring dishes like enchiladas, tacos, and delicious queso.

food_card.title: Barbecue
food_card.description: Texas barbecue is a must-try, with smoked meats like brisket, ribs, and sausages. Local barbecue joints are a favorite among food enthusiasts.

food_card.title: Chicken-Fried Steak
food_card.description: Chicken-fried steak, a Southern classic, is a hearty dish of breaded and fried steak smothered in creamy gravy.

food_card.title: Food Trucks
food_card.description: Dallas's food truck scene is diverse and vibrant, offering everything from gourmet burgers to international cuisine on wheels.

food_card.title: Craft Beer
food_card.description: The craft beer scene in Dallas is booming, with numerous breweries and brewpubs offering a wide range of artisanal beers.

hotels_card.title: The Joule
hotels_card.description: The Joule is a luxury boutique hotel in downtown Dallas, known for its stylish design, rooftop pool, and vibrant atmosphere.

hotels_card.title: The Ritz-Carlton, Dallas
hotels_card.description: The Ritz-Carlton offers elegant accommodations, a world-class spa, and fine dining in the heart of Uptown Dallas.

hotels_card.title: Omni Dallas Hotel
hotels_card.description: The Omni Dallas Hotel is a downtown gem with spacious rooms, multiple dining options, and easy access to the Convention Center.

hotels_card.title: The Adolphus
hotels_card.description: The Adolphus is a historic hotel offering a blend of old-world charm and modern comfort, centrally located in downtown Dallas.

hotels_card.alt: Four Seasons Resort and Club Dallas at Las Colinas
hotels_card.title: Four Seasons Resort and Club Dallas at Las Colinas
hotels_card.description: Located in the Las Colinas area, this Four Seasons resort offers luxury accommodations, golf, and a serene atmosphere.

transport_card.title: DART Light Rail
transport_card.description: The Dallas Area Rapid Transit (DART) light rail system provides convenient public transportation throughout the Dallas metro area.

transport_card.title: Dallas Love Field Airport
transport_card.description: Dallas Love Field is a major airport serving domestic flights and is conveniently located near the city center.

transport_card.title: DFW International Airport
transport_card.description: Dallas/Fort Worth International Airport (DFW) is one of the largest and busiest airports in the United States, serving both domestic and international flights.

transport_card.title: Rental Cars
transport_card.description: Rental cars are readily available at airports and throughout the city for those who prefer to have their own transportation.
